Name: AI Manga King
My Role: Product Designer — UI/UX Design, Front End, Agile Environment, Community Building
About the Project: AI Manga King addresses the need for AI tools tailored to manga creators, solving challenges like character consistency, crucial for professionals and hobbyists alike.
About the project #2: As lead designer, I led the user research, wire-framed, and led the implementation of key features like the Character Hub, Gallery Grid, and Prompt Terminal. I also built an active community of creators, produced a viral video, and ensured the platform met the needs of professionals and enthusiasts alike.

Name: Tofu
My Role: Product Designer — UI/UX Design, User Research, Branding, Agile Environment, Community Building
About the Project: Tofu is a voice-first messenger app that reimagines communication by prioritizing voice interactions over text. It offers users a natural and engaging way to connect, emphasizing expressiveness and accessibility
About the project #2: As the sole designer, I created a streamlined, intuitive interface that supports seamless voice messaging. Tofu’s clean design enhances usability, making it easy for users to send and manage voice messages while staying connected in a more personal and meaningful way.
Number_Description_2: Users use at least one key feature daily for the first 30 days
Number_Description_3: Clicks saved on sending a voice message

Name: Unlocking the Power of Coffee Grounds
Bigger Heading: An App for Recycling Coffee Ground
Timeline: 3 Months, Finalist in 2021 European Student Service Design Challenge
My Role: UX Lead — Product Management, User Research, Visual Design, User Flows, Rapid Prototyping
Team Members:
Huiwen Shi, UX Designer
Yu Huang, UX Designer
Zoey Zhu, UX Designer
About the project #2:
It’s such a shame that the 800 thousand tons of Spent Coffee Grounds (SCG) produced globally every year, with their potential to be re-utilized as a valuable recourse, end up in the landfill, resulting in millions of tons of methane emissions. The project takes on a circular mindset and unlocks the untapped power of coffee grounds.

As the lead designer in the team of 4, by providing a frictionless collection process that is fun and engaging, we designed solutions that encourage and educate people on the circular SCG business model, growing sustainable habits, and building a robust and sustainable community in the process. When our users contribute coffee grounds they collect, the GroundUP team uses them to make furniture and logs to cut down fewer trees.
The Results:
